05d97e27-7391-4e9c-a357-e7d2e3afb102.text:
In this chapter, researchers should present a summary of the project: the name, duration, purpose, information regarding the funding agency, the status of approval of financing and other information related to their project. Additionally researchers should also present information related to costs. 

Example:
"Project XPTO running from 26.06.2020 to 26.06.2022, will focus on the study XYZ, has successfully applied for an FCT grant, which has since been granted.
05d97e27-7391-4e9c-a357-e7d2e3afb102.title: Project, Funding and Costs

46e9f658-efc4-4619-a885-ffaebb4d21f4.text:
In this chapter, researchers need to characterize each dataset that will be creating during the project and/or after it conclusion. The title, keywords, description, authors, language and metadata standards are the most common descriptors used for this purpose. 

If personal or sensitive data is present in the datasets, this fact should signaled in the dataset characterization. Additionally, standards can be applied during data processing (e.g. General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR)). Researchers might find it necessary to clarify which tools or methodology is to be used for data quality assurance. Researchers must also provide information regarding the policies and methods applied with regards to Security and Privacy.  

Example: 
“Researchers should offer descriptions on the software used during the project, its updates, any antivirus software installed, network configurations, and list any existing risks that related to unsafe connections, finally they should also list any possible technical failures.”

Additionally, researchers should also detail any technical resources that were required during the project (e.g. software, hardware, measurement sensors, plots, etc.). All information provided in this step should be verified with the help of the project’s technical staff.

Example:
“In the Biodata.pt compute platform, researchers resort to a datacenter that contains x blade servers running a Linux OS. All these servers are monitored remotely and controlled through a custom version of Openstack, thus allowing for the allocation of virtual machines as required”

Metadata standards are commonly used for the description of the digital objects, such as Dublin Core or personalized metadata schema based on INSPIRE for example, or Darwin Core that used for facilitating the sharing of information about biological diversity. Researchers must declare any metadata standards that are used within the project. 

esearchers need to identify which data will be shared and for how long will it be preserved. Any existing data reuse restrictions must also be identified, and an appropriate license should be chosen. 

Researchers must also characterize the appropriate data repositories to preserve and share their data. This characterization should also include technical details, such as its trustworthiness, versioning support, existence of automated citation, etc.

Example:

“The Endoscopic bioimaging dataset comprises solely of processed data. The ethics committee has reviewed the dataset and given its authorization for it to be shared and preserved.

During the storage and description process a Share-Alike Creative Commons License was thus applied. This licence requires that copies or adaptations of the work to be released under the same or similar licence as the original.

Data will be stored at the INESC-TEC research data repository that guarantees long-term preservation for all deposited datasets.”
46e9f658-efc4-4619-a885-ffaebb4d21f4.title: Datasets and Preservation

b6256b0a-0bf9-4cf3-8b5a-507fdf819d6a.text:
In this chapter, researchers are asked to provide general information about the Data Management Plan (DMP), and its staff. 

The information gathered in this chapter will provide an overview on the administrative data associated with the DMP (e.g. creation date, language, title, description, etc.). Additionally, information on the DMP staff will also be collected. This will provide a characterization of the various staff members that are relevant to the DMP .

Example:
“The person responsible for the collection, processing and preservation of the data is Ree Searcher. Email: testemail@gmail.com. This project has 2 responsible entities, such as INESC TEC and FEUP. Email: fakeemail@inesctec.pt; fakeemail@feup.pt”.
b6256b0a-0bf9-4cf3-8b5a-507fdf819d6a.title: Administrative Data

038bc3ca-1007-42de-972a-9db7181ff906.text:
A unique identifier for this Technical Resource.

Example:

"Serial Name x123456"
038bc3ca-1007-42de-972a-9db7181ff906.title: Identifier

06de417c-152c-4a70-a3f7-a779535ec00e.text: A URL where the dataset can be downloaded.
06de417c-152c-4a70-a3f7-a779535ec00e.title: Download URL

0cad6866-1037-47a8-8fa6-7b31feecabbe.text: The name of the  DMP staff member.
0cad6866-1037-47a8-8fa6-7b31feecabbe.title: Name

11b1ecaf-58de-40fd-9f04-0ec1924099a6.text: A preservation statement for the dataset. An indication of why the dataset should be preserved.
11b1ecaf-58de-40fd-9f04-0ec1924099a6.title: Preservation Statement

12dc1e7f-93c4-4e51-84e2-65ca5374e167.text:
Characterization of all projects related with this DMP.

The term ‘project’ used in this questionare equates to an ‘action’ in the European Comission Horizon 2020 documentation.
12dc1e7f-93c4-4e51-84e2-65ca5374e167.title: Project

1930ebb3-81ee-4e39-840f-7c49b69bdcaf.text:
Data quality assurance statement.

Data quality statements (or declarations) describe the key characteristics of data which impact on quality, so that potential users can make informed decisions about fitness for use. Data quality statements should report both the strengths and limitations of the data.
1930ebb3-81ee-4e39-840f-7c49b69bdcaf.title: Data Quality Assurance

Example:

"Physical access control."

92428580-748f-4c51-8ea3-c05b605d249e.title: DMP Identifier

92c53099-9872-4890-909c-6aa5c89c6f84.text:
In relation to Costs, researchers should provide information related to all associated costs. 

Researchers need to consider the following types of questions:
*Where should data be stored and preserved?
*What data should be stored and preserved? 
*What type of storage will be used?
*What type of access with the storage have?
*Who should be performing the tasks?
*What resources are required? 
*Etc.
92c53099-9872-4890-909c-6aa5c89c6f84.title: Costs

95846d36-85b4-491c-b9b5-296a05359e60.text: The identifier and type of metadata standard.
95846d36-85b4-491c-b9b5-296a05359e60.title: Metadata Identifier

96d4d905-618b-4f1b-858a-4ef8423a603b.text:
The funder identifier, according to the Corssref Funder Registry.

Example:

"http://dx.doi.org/10.13039/501100000780" DOI for the European Comission
"http://dx.doi.org/10.13039/501100005635" DOI for the Fundação para a Ciência e Tecnologia
96d4d905-618b-4f1b-858a-4ef8423a603b.title: Identifier

9fb283f2-75fa-4697-b41b-d91d004ea71d.title: Description

b42683c5-2e8e-45c8-85f7-1a8f8c44c7cb.title: Type

b84caaf1-94e4-412d-90b6-9f8d2c4d8e7a.title: Description

ba1a7eb0-b390-4818-9da0-bfb1a9383547.text:
Must be set each time DMP is modified. Indicates DMP version.

The date should observe the xsd:datetime format. Example:

"2019-09-18T00:00:00"
ba1a7eb0-b390-4818-9da0-bfb1a9383547.title: Modified

bafb7dbc-209c-456e-939b-fcad0c62c68d.text:
Funders must be identified through an unique identifier and their type.

Funder identifiers can be found in the Crossref funder registy.
bafb7dbc-209c-456e-939b-fcad0c62c68d.title: Funder

c0196911-7228-4a63-9698-9b455584f988.title: Funding Status

c64af56b-73c5-445c-8ced-5bab570ce7dd.title: Currency Code

c7c7b9c2-fa42-4218-b520-e90d83f1868e.title: Certified With

e1f6c539-b9ef-4b0d-9bd7-7dc6aaf7cfdf.title: Technical Resource

e61809ca-ee52-46bf-bb3d-bc026617adc4.title: Staff Identifier

e7ecc501-b029-4f4b-b4ae-b3473c75d637.text:
A unique identifier for this DMP.

Example:

"http://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.1461713"
e7ecc501-b029-4f4b-b4ae-b3473c75d637.title: Identifier

e84e0707-3be0-4928-a7b6-964aa18497ba.text: Dataset identifier, e.g. for a DOI of the Dataset if it was published.
e84e0707-3be0-4928-a7b6-964aa18497ba.title: Identifier

f04b91f8-b423-4302-bc7c-6db9060d013b.text:
Date and time of the first version of a DMP. Must not be changed in subsequent DMPs.

The date should observe the xsd:datetime format. Example:

"2019-09-18T00:00:00"
f04b91f8-b423-4302-bc7c-6db9060d013b.title: Created

f0af1270-0b5f-45b9-a4dd-3f1a9c57c36c.text: The identifier and type of the host.
f0af1270-0b5f-45b9-a4dd-3f1a9c57c36c.title: Host Identifier

f3224bb8-e63e-4d11-860d-22293b343abb.text:
A description of the security or privacy issue.

Example:

"Server with data must be kept in a locked room."
f3224bb8-e63e-4d11-860d-22293b343abb.title: Description

f74d9335-add3-4f95-8d9b-ba0076df2c7e.text: An indication of whether the host is supportive of versioning.
f74d9335-add3-4f95-8d9b-ba0076df2c7e.title: Supports Versioning

f8681d8e-b911-4837-9f8e-c05c298d19c2.text: To list people that play role in data management related to this DMP, e.g. resoponsible for performing actions described in this DMP.
f8681d8e-b911-4837-9f8e-c05c298d19c2.title: DMP Staff

f869a7b6-1cf5-4418-bd5d-3b04d8680c16.text:
The type of dataset that is being described.

The value should comply with the Controlled Vocabulary for Resource Type Genres.

Example:

"A dataset comprising entirely of images should be assigned the following type:
http://purl.org/dc/dcmitype/Image"

"A dataset comprising entirely of books should be assigned the following type:
http://purl.org/ontology/bibo/Book"
f869a7b6-1cf5-4418-bd5d-3b04d8680c16.title: Dataset Type

fad9e449-1d11-437a-8a75-827a0570bd25.text: A unique identifier for the contact person or institution for this DMP.
fad9e449-1d11-437a-8a75-827a0570bd25.title: Contact Identifier

466b604c-a173-4231-adf4-d44fdc3af3b5.label: Controlled Vocabulary for Resource Type Genres (Version 1.1)

97d4e22c-82e5-4fca-af67-c07ed90003ae.description: A full set of questions covering the full extend of the DMP Common Standards Model.
97d4e22c-82e5-4fca-af67-c07ed90003ae.name: Full Information

metrics.description: The Findability metric describes how easily data can be located. The score associated with an answer will be higher if it makes it easier for humans or for computers to locate your data set, e.g. if it ends up in an index or has a unique resolvable identifier.
metrics.title: Findability

metrics.description: The Accessibility metric describes how well the access to the database is described and how easy it is to implement. The score associated with an answer will be higher if it makes it easier for humans and computers to get to the data. This is determined by e.g. the protocol for accessing the data or for authenticating users, and also by the guaranteed longevity of the repository. Note that this is different from the Openness metric!
metrics.title: Accessibility

metrics.description: The Interoperability metric describes how well the data interoperates with other data. The score associated with an answer will be higher if it makes it easier for humans and computers to couple the data with other data and 'understand' relationships. This is influenced by the use of standard ontologies for different fields and proper descriptions of the relations. It is also influenced by proper standard metadata that is agreed by the community.
metrics.title: Interoperability

metrics.description: The Reusability metric describes how well the data is suitable for reuse in other context. The score associated with an answer will be higher if it makes it easier for humans and computers to reuse the data. This is influenced largely by proper description of how the data was obtained, and also by the conditions that are put on the reuse (license and, for personally identifying information, consent).
metrics.title: Reusability

metrics.description: The Good DMP Practice metric describes how appreciated a process is among Data Stewards. A score associated with an answer will be high if a practice would be considered preferable over alternatives, generally a good idea.
metrics.title: Good DMP Practice

metrics.description: The Openness metric describes how Open the data are available. Note that this is different from the Accessibility metric. A score associated with an answer will be high if the data will be as open as possible, and low if voluntary restrictions apply to access and re-use.
metrics.title: Openness

questionnaireName: Data Management Plan Unidade de Genómica

value.value: ONEIDA is a consortium established between Instituto de Tecnologia Química e Biológica António Xavier (ITQB NOVA), Instituto Gulbenkian de Ciência (IGC) and Instituto de Medicina Molecular (iMM) to match the urgent need for effective solutions in the prevention and control of infectious diseases and ­antibiotic resistance.
GenomePT – National Laboratory for Genome Sequencing and Analysis

GenomePT aims to enhance the participation of Portuguese scientists in national and international genome projects, and promote genome research in important areas such as health, drug discovery, environment, marine resources, freshwater and biotechnology (agri-food, green chemistry).
The cost of buying and maintaining equipment for the laboratory.
The cost of maintaining the facilities.
The cost of reagents used in the process.
The cost of using external services for sequencing DNA or RNA
The cost of storaging the data produced in the projects.
This DMP serves to characterize the functioning of the Unidade de Genómica at the Instituto Gulbenkian para a Ciência in Oeiras.
Quality Control of DNA and RNA
RIM and DIM for RNA and DNA QC
It checks the QC of nucleic acids
Only staff can directly access data. Users can access pending a request approval.
Files will be stored in xls and pfd in the storage server (AFS)
Storage server (AFS) managed by IGC IT
The data will stay storage because users can always request it.
Used index and sample name (sample sheet)

ONEIDA is a consortium established between Instituto de Tecnologia Química e Biológica António Xavier (ITQB NOVA), Instituto Gulbenkian de Ciência (IGC) and Instituto de Medicina Molecular (iMM) to match the urgent need for effective solutions in the prevention and control of infectious diseases and ­antibiotic resistance.

GenomePT aims to enhance the participation of Portuguese scientists in national and international genome projects, and promote genome research in important areas such as health, drug discovery, environment, marine resources, freshwater and biotechnology (agri-food, green chemistry).
GenomePT – National Laboratory for Genome Sequencing and Analysis
The cost of buying and maintaining equipment for the laboratory.
The cost of maintaining the facilities.
The cost of reagents used in the process.
The cost of using external services for sequencing DNA or RNA
The cost of storaging the data produced in the projects.
RIM and DIM for RNA and DNA QC
Quality Control of DNA and RNA
Only staff can directly access data. Users can access pending a request approval.
Files will be stored in xls and pfd in the storage server (AFS)
Storage server (AFS) managed by IGC IT
It checks the QC of nucleic acids
The data will stay storage because users can always request it.
Used index and sample name (sample sheet)
This DMP serves to characterize the functioning of the Unidade de Genómica at the Instituto Gulbenkian para a Ciência in Oeiras.
